audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing how to link a Samsung Smart TV with Alexa using the SmartThings app. He maintains an excited tone as he invites the listener to stick around. He then welcomes listeners to the tutorial and states that there's a video on how to link your Samsung Smart TV within the Alexa home system. The speaker discusses limitations in controlling older TV models and explains that Samsung has updated the app and now provides more control for TVs from 2018 or newer. He provides a link to Samsung's website for additional information on level of integration. Before proceeding, the speaker recommends removing any previous setup of skill and accounts and removing the TV from the SmartThings app to start fresh. The speaker expresses that we should go ahead and just jump right in.

The clip features a single male speaker recommending that a TV be connected to a wireless network rather than a wired one, stating that "with wireless, the connection stays active," and explains that ethernet ports turn off on wired connections. The speaker has a conversational, informative tone.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker explaining how to connect a TV to a wireless network and how to use the SmartThings app, emphasizing the importance of having the app updated. He then mentions setting up a SmartThings account. His tone is instructional. Finally, he indicates that the process will lead to the home screen.

The clip features a male speaker with an informative and instructional tone, explaining how to add a device by tapping a plus sign and selecting from a list, such as a TV, noting that there might be regional lockouts and a support button for device information. He then transitions into guiding the listener to set up the TV, mentioning steps like choosing a location and room, and turning on the TV, waiting for communication between devices to request a pin code. A background ambient noise suggests an indoor environment.

The clip begins with one male speaker noting a device being found on the network. He explains that it may be named "TV Challenger" or another name if it was renamed from the factory default. He directs the listener to tap the device and notes it says "connecting to your TV." He then describes that the listener should check the PIN shown on the TV and enter it on the phone, acknowledging the PIN is in the upper right hand corner. He dictates the PIN code and explains that it should be typed in before instructing the listener to tap "done". He mentions the TV is being registered to a Samsung account and that it has been successfully connected. He states the user can either keep the default name of the TV or change it, and he decides to change it to "living room." He then acknowledges they successfully added it into the SmartThings App.

A single male speaker explains that they are going to link SmartThings with the Alexa app using the SmartThings skill in Alexa. He instructs the listener to download the Alexa app from the Play Store or App Store if they haven't already. The speaker has an informative tone.

The clip begins with a male speaker offering instructions, suggesting to use the Alexa app and browse the "skills" option. He mentions tapping the magnifying glass and typing "smart things". A click sound is heard as he clarifies to use the "smart things" option, not "smart things classic". His tone is instructional and straightforward.

The clip starts with a male speaker explaining a technical process, instructing the listener to "tap on where it says enable to use." He then explains that the next step involves signing in with the Samsung account that was used to add the TV to the SmartThings app, emphasizing the importance of using the same account for device syncing. He prompts the listener to "sign in with Samsung account" and "punch that information in." The speaker's tone is instructional and clear.

The audio begins with a single male speaker explaining a process, saying "Once you've got your credentials" with an informative tone. He continues to describe clicking on "authorize" to allow Amazon Alexa access. He then notes the successful linking of a SmartThings account.

A male speaker explains the next step involves closing a window to "discover smart home devices" that can be controlled with Alexa. The speaker clicks on "close," opening a new window where he indicates the option to "discover devices," noting it may take up to 45 seconds for the device to be detected. The speaker then suggests that if the device isn't discovered, to unlink and remove everything, reattempting the setup. He expresses hope that the process succeeds in identifying the living room TV.

The audio clip starts with a male speaker expressing satisfaction and reporting that the TV has been found and connected, stating "one TV found and connected". He continues, informing someone that their TV has been added to their Alexa account and instructs them to continue setting up their device, his tone is upbeat and helpful. Immediately following his speech, there is silence.

The clip features a male speaker explaining how to control a device. He first states that, "now you can control the device, just like any other smart device and organize it as well." Then, he begins to demonstrate control features. The clip then transitions to examples of verbal commands given to Alexa, where the man tells Alexa to turn off the TV. He continues by telling Alexa to set volume, and switch the input to HDMI1. He then acknowledges that there's "a little bit more control on what I can do."

The clip starts with a male speaker referring to a previous video, noting that, previously, he was only able to turn his TV on and off, without controlling volume, inputs, or channels. He notes that the SmartThings app update enables some of these controls on his 2018 TV, but not launching apps, which he infers to be a feature of 2019 or newer TVs. The speaker states he will leave a link in the video description to supported models and integration levels to check if the viewer's TV is on the list and can be controlled. Finally, the speaker concludes that it's a pretty smooth process to link systems together.

The audio clip begins with a single male speaker wrapping up a tutorial, thanking viewers, hoping they enjoyed it and got their tasks completed. He encourages them to like, share, subscribe, and visit their online shop for merchandise. He ends with "Peace." Following the speech, there is upbeat electronic music with a dance vibe. The music features synthesized sounds and is the only sound present during that time.
